intro: Bupleurum commutatum f. anatolicum, commonly known as the Anatolian bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are alternate, pinnate, and often have a fragrant scent. It is native to parts of Turkey and the Mediterranean region, where it thrives in sunny, well-drained environments.
